directions.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Pat chicken dry.
Rub chicken with a bit of salt, pepper, garlic, and oregano.
Coat pan with cooking oil of choice.
Arrange chicken on pan.
Cook chicken for 30 minutes to brown the chicken.
Set oven to 350 and continue cooking until juices run clear, or internal temperature is 170 degrees.
Sprinkle some basil on top before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Cover pan with aluminum foil
Coat foil with cooking oil of choice.
Arrange pecans on foil-covered pan.
Toast the pecans, but don't let them burn!
Cut brussles in half, along the stem.
Take pecans out, let cool for a minute.
Again, coat the pan with cooking oil of choice.
Toss brussles with oil, maple syrup, salt and pepper.
Roast the brussles for 20 minutes or until golden brown in spots.
Transfer to a serving dish, and top with nuts.
The key to cooking good fish is always heat! Preheat your oven to 450 degrees.
Cover pan with aluminum foil
Season your salmon with salt, pepper, garlic, oregano, basil, and onion powder.
Rub a coat of high-heat cooking oil of your choice over your pan to help season things a bit more, and to avoid a sticky mess.
Bake for about 15 minutes.
When the salmon is done, it will be easy to flake with a fork. If you're nervous, stick a thermometer in it: The internal temperature should be at least 145 degrees fahrenheit.
Enjoy that delicious salmon!

recipes.name: Pineapple and Pepper Baked Ham Steaks

directions.step: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Cut the ham steak into portions roughly the size of your pineapple rings
Slice a bell pepper width-wise, to make circular rings.
Cover each side of the hamsteaks with mustard and brown sugar.
Put each ham steak into its own piece of aluminum foil. This will be used to wrap the ham and keep things juicy as it bakes!
Put a pineapple ring and a pepper ring on top of each steak.
Add about 1 tablespoon of butter on top of the steaks, in the center of each pineapple ring.
Bake for about 20-30 minutes, or until heated through.
Unwrap the ham and drain the juices. This is great to serve over some rice. Enjoy!
Chop bell pepper and onion into medium-sized chunks (not too small)
Slice zucchini
Slice carrots
Coat a non-stick pan with cooking oil.
Place your pan on the stove, and set it to medium heat.

Once your pan is hot, carefully drop all your cut veggies onto the pan and let them sautee in the oil for about 10 minutes, or until you see that they are beginning to soften. When ready, you'll notice the onion turn transluscent and start to brown.
When the veggies are sauteed, pour some curry sauce in, and mix it thoroughly.
Let this simmer on low-medium heat for about 10 more minutes.
Once it's done, let it cool for a bit and enjoy!
